name: Westgate Vacation Villas

reviews.text: Upon arrival after a long 10 + hour drive from North Carolina, we had to stand in 2 long lines and then wait for a hotel person to escort us to our villa. Don't get wrong it is a nice place to stay, but if I had to do it again. No I will not spend half the money that I budgeted to stay here again. All the packages that we were promised from July 2005 all of a sudden no one know what salespersons (---) that was who sold us the timeshare. We ended up staying in the last villas on the 6th floor whom we had an senior citizens and a kid traveling with us. The staff was rude and unprofessional to speak of. I called to make a complaint to go nowhere.
reviews.title: It is not worth the money

likes.disliked: — unpleasant stay, price that was paid

reviews.text: Take my advise
reviews.title: Don't be fooled, not a 5 star resort

likes.disliked: — Dirty rooms, staff, construction, sales pitches.

reviews.text: Don't stay here or purchase the timeshare.
reviews.title: Close to Everything -- Location, Location, Location!

reviews.text: There seems to be a consistent theme to these reviews. I am no different. The only redeeming quality is the proximity to WDW. Everything else was about selling timeshares. They were more interested in selling to prospective owners than helping the ones they have. Between the dirty bathrooms, floors, major construction starting at 8am and weathered look of the older properties I would not recommend this resort to anyone.
reviews.title: Beautiful Rooms Do Not Cover Up Horrible Service

reviews.text: You can't beat this location. The property is not very congested, which I love! There are 2-3 story buildings that make up the villas. There was only one family above our heads as opposed to 6 or 7 floors of occupants like you might find at other resorts. There are a lot of free activities available to guests -- bicycles, tennis, paddleboats, over 10 pools and hot tubs and more!
reviews.title: Not up to Par

reviews.text: I stayed here with my husband and 2 children Feb. 8 - 15, 2008 in a 2-bedroom, 2-bath unit. The grounds were pretty and it was easy to find the check in area. We arrived late -check in was a little slow but no heavy pressure for timeshare tour. We had one phone call offering the timeshare tour the next day, but that was it. We turned down the escort to our unit with no argument. We were in building CC - 7. My first thought upon entering was "this place was decorated in the 80's"! Lots of mirrors and pastels. Everything was dated, but working. The master bedroom had a hard mattress. There was a huge 2-person jacuzzi tub. I did not like that the bathroom was open to the bedroom, with just the toilet in its' own closet. Also, the toilet light and fan were connected, so if you turn on the light the rather loud fan runs. Lots of drawer space in both rooms. We had a screened porch overlooking a pond - very nice. Laundry and dishwash detergent, paper towels, garbage bags, etc. and 1 complementary coffee were provided. It came with sweetener and powdered cream packets included. We really liked the coffee- you can get more at their store. Due to flight delays we were arriving late, so I called and was able to order a few groceries, and they were in our room when we arrived. You can also do this online I think from 5 to 1 day in advance. Location is nice, not too crowded and easy to get to the parks. There was a Publix nearby where we got the rest of our groceries. Did not use any of the pools, facilities, etc. we were die-hard theme park goers. We received maid service and fresh towels once in the middle of the week. Our last trip we stayed in a condo on Disney property, Old Key West, and while the Disney property was nicer in appearance, my family's comfort level was really nearly identical here. I have attached some photos- it is obvious from the other photos posted that some rooms have newer furnishings and appointments than others.
reviews.title: Dated but comfortable
Geat location
reviews.text: We traded into this resort and got a 3 bedroom. The location is great for Disney, restaurants near by, plenty to do for all ages at the resort property. Staff very friendly and helpful. Clean. Great for families.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the w v villas for 2 weeks in feb 2008 was a little worried after reading reviews about the place.
reviews.title: great at the westgate vacation villas

reviews.text: Have to say we were never bothered once about viewing/ buying timeshares we were left alone to get on with our holiday.
reviews.title: Great Time Great Location

reviews.text: Had a small problem with the coffee maker someone came stright away to fix it after no probs whatsoever.
reviews.title: Average at Best.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a 2 bedroom villa March 1-8.
reviews.title: Nice Place and Great Location

likes.liked: — Room size, resort location, nice grounds
likes.disliked: — construction noise, leaf blower & hedge trimmer noise,

reviews.text: The room was very spacious and clean. It looked like it had been recently painted and appliances were new, except for the dishwasher. The beds were fine for us.
reviews.title: Nice place but service could use improvement

reviews.text: We had a ground floor unit, M6. It backed up to a pond that was very low on water, but it was nice to see the ducks and turtles.
reviews.title: Trust the reviews on this one!

reviews.text: We were guests of owners, so we were not bothered by people asking us to take a timeshare tour. There is a lot of construction noise during the day coming from the new tower they are building. But it didn't seem to bother any of us.
reviews.title: Avoid the 90 minute tour!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The grounds were very clean but there were always workers using leaf blowers and power hedge trimmers. The sound of that was irritating.
reviews.title: Beautiful Place - Went prepared

likes.disliked: — expensive store, no free shuttle to parks

reviews.title: Say NO to Block PP and say NO to the tour!!
reviews.text: We stayed at Westgate Vacation Villas for 10 days over Easter. Id read all the previous reviews and was a bit worried. Id rung a week before to request an upstairs one bed villa overlooking the lake if possible. Upon arrival they had no note of my request but did upgrade us to a top floor two bed villa which we were very happy about. However upon arrival at block PP, we realised that this upgrade came with a price - the villa was right next to the Goods In/Out staff entrance and was very noisy and busy first thing in the morning and last thing at night every day with loud staff arriving/departing and noisy goods vehicles. We turned down the timeshare tour and breakfast that they offered at check in and told them we didnt need to wait for an escort (a timeshare sales person) and to just give us a map to find our villa and we'd find the place ourself (it was so simple). We were not bothered again by any of the sales team. We had bought tickets before arrving in Florida on the disney website so didnt need disney tickets, though they offered us $75 cash instead which still wasnt worth sitting through the timeshare spiel, we've done it before elsewhere and it was bad enough then!! The villa was spacious and clean (some bedsheets had some stains on (blood and mold I think) but we replaced those with spares from the closet). The villa had everything you could possibly need, it was very well stocked, even giving you a box of wash powder and dish and dishwasher detergent. Loved the whirlpool tub in the bedroom too! The staff were curteous and efficient when we called guest services. There was no daily housekeeping but we were offered fresh linen and towels each day. The pools and spa were great - heated and clean and the one nearest us wasnt that busy as we were right on the edge of the resort. The main pools were much busier. The pool bar at pool 1 is great and the girls there serve great cocktails. Joe's deli in the store make great sandwiches and there is everything you could need in the store. Disney properties were really close and there were loads of chain restaurants on highway 192 nearby. We loved all the outlet malls, Prime, Premium, Lake Buena Vista etc. We had no problems with lines checking in or with parking at all. I would recommend this resort, we had a good time, but we would've liked a lake view villa with a balcony as that wouldve just topped off our stay, rather than Block PP (one of the oldest and noisiest blocks in the resort).

my husband, granddaughter and I stayed 3/16- 3/20/08 and had a very nice time. No problems checking in or out. The rooms are beautiful and clean.The only problem I had was for what it cost to stay they should have a free shuttle to all the Parks . We drove to the parks and parking was $ 11.00 per day.
reviews.title: AVery Nice Time

likes.liked: — Everyone was really helpful, the rooms were great
likes.disliked: — no free shuttle to the parks

reviews.text: We did the tour for the lower price. We paid about $500.00 for 8 days and they gave us 2 adult tickets to Disney Magic Kindom.
reviews.title: Good Bad and the UGLY

likes.disliked: — Too busy... They are in a business... Too much traffic on roads... pools small and too crowded

reviews.text: The tip* on the tour... If you do not want to buy. GO EARLY! Eat breakfast before you go. The prices start around 20k for a 2 bedroom. With a 800 year maint fee... Rip off!
reviews.title: Overall a good deal!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My story for sales people..... "I agreed it was a lovely place but decided to purchase a condo/house on the beach in Clearwater".. I was firm with my statment and was out in about 1 hour.
reviews.title: Good stay at the Villas

likes.liked: — Whirlpool tub! Quiet and peaceful! Laundry facilities in room

description: Just 1 mile to Walt Disney World Resort and minutes to Universal Orlando Resort, SeaWorld Orlando, Orange County Convention Center, downtown Orlando and the Orlando International Airport. Featuring fully equipped kitchens, onsite amenities include thirteen outdoor pools and hot tubs, fitness center, lakeside marina and dock, activities center, free scheduled transportation to theme parks, 24-hour business center, attraction tickets desk, VIP services concierge and more!
